snippet: Economic anxiety amid a dwindling oil and gas industry is raising difficult questions about the future. It is also shaping a Senate race in which a Democrat is seeking re-election in a state long dominated by Republicans.
abstract: Economic anxiety amid dwindling oil and gas industry in Alaska is raising difficult questions about the future, and it is also shaping the Senate contest; in a state long dominated by Republicans, Democratic incumbent Mark Begich is widely regarded as an underdog against his Republican challenger Dan Sullivan, former state attorney general and natural resources commissioner (Series: States In Play).
lead_paragraph: Economic anxiety amid a dwindling oil and gas industry is raising difficult questions about the future. It is also shaping a Senate race in which a Democrat is seeking re-election in a state long dominated by Republicans.

headline.main: As Energy Boom Ends, a Political Identity Crisis in Alaska
headline.print_headline: As Energy Boom Ends, a Political Identity Crisis
